title: Binance: Latest Proof-of-Reserve report paints a bleak picture for the exchange - AMBCrypto News
content:
Binance’s latest POR showed an increase in exchange net balances.

BNB has been trading at a loss in the past two days.

After the FTX crash, Binance, under the leadership of its CEO, spearheaded the initiative for regular Proof of Reserve from cryptocurrency exchanges. The exchange has issued its latest Proof of Reserve (POR) report, demonstrating the platform’s liquidity. What does the latest POR say about the exchange?

Read Binance Coin (BNB) Price Prediction 2023-24

Binance user deposits decrease

The recent update of Binance’s Proof-of-Reserve (POR) revealed significant liquidity on the exchange. The data indicated that the exchange’s net asset balance surpassed its users. Among the stablecoins, USDT dominated the exchange’s and its users’ net balance.

However, a decline in user balances was evident upon comparing the current POR with the previous month’s data. Specifically, BTC deposits decreased by 0.6%, resulting in a reduction of 3,835 BTC.

Additionally, user balances for ETH and BNB decreased by 2.3% and 1.4%, respectively, reducing 95,000 ETH and 423,000 BNB. Furthermore, USDT holdings decreased by 1.2%, causing a reduction of 197 million USDT.

Binance shows varying on-chain metrics

Examining the activities on the Binance Chain revealed distinct trends in its Total Value Locked (TVL), number of users, and volume. According to DefiLlama’s analysis, the TVL experienced an upward trend at the beginning of the year, surging to over $5 billion before gradually declining since June. At present, TVL stands at approximately $3.2 billion.

In contrast, the number of users displayed a reverse trend compared to the TVL. Starting the year with around 700,000 users, it has steadily increased, surpassing 1 million users at the current time.

The trading volume stood at over $155 million, with the chart indicating significant fluctuations and oscillations.

BNB remains bearish

Based on the daily timeframe chart, Binance Coin’s (BNB) price trend has been relatively stagnant in recent weeks. At the time of writing, it was experiencing losses and continued the downward movement observed in the previous trading session.

Realistic or not, here’s BNB’s market cap in BTC terms

The current price was hovering around $242, with significant support provided by its short Moving Average (yellow line).

Furthermore, the Relative Strength Index (RSI) indicated that BNB has been unable to break out of its bearish trend. The RSI was slightly below the neutral line at the time of writing, suggesting that the market sentiment was leaning toward the bearish side.

title: List of 'Crypto Securities' Published by SEC: BNB, ADA, MATIC, SOL and Other Tokens - U.Today
content:
Disclaimer: The opinions expressed by our writers are their own and do not represent the views of U.Today. The financial and market information provided on U.Today is intended for informational purposes only. U.Today is not liable for any financial losses incurred while trading cryptocurrencies. Conduct your own research by contacting financial experts before making any investment decisions. We believe that all content is accurate as of the date of publication, but certain offers mentioned may no longer be available.

Advertisement

According to a recent tweet by Chinese journalist and crypto blogger Colin Wu, the SEC has spread the word about a list of cryptos it believes to be securities. The list has been published by CoinGecko analytics platform.

The list includes as many as 48 digital currencies. Among them are some top 10 and top 20 digital cryptocurrencies — Binance Coin (BNB), Cardano (ADA), Solana (SOL), Polygon (MATIC), Algorand (ALGO), Tron (TRX) and many others.

Bitcoin and Ethereum are not on this list. Neither is the Ripple-affiliated XRP coin.

Coingecko has opened a list of tokens listed as securities by the US SEC. There are a total of 48 tokens, including BNB ADA SOL TRX MATIC TON BUSD ATOM FIL ICP NEAR ALGO SAND AXS MANA FLOW CHZ BTT and more. https://t.co/KE3GI0D3cx — Wu Blockchain (@WuBlockchain) August 7, 2023

SEC's witch hunt on altcoins

The SEC has recently been conducting quite an aggressive campaign against all cryptos but Bitcoin and Ethereum, claiming that pretty much all digital tokens are in fact unregistered securities since there are developers who sell their tokens to investors, and those investors expect profits from those digital currencies. This is similar to the principle on which shares, stocks and other securities work, according to the chair of the U.S. regulator, Gary Gensler.

The very first "victim" of the securities agency of the U.S. was Ripple Labs fintech behemoth and the XRP token it works with. The SEC accused the company, its cofounder Chris Larsen and the current chief executive Brad Garlinghouse of selling XRP as unregistered securities to both institutional and retail investors earning more than $1 billion.

This summer, as reported by U.Today, Judge Analisa Torres ruled that it is only institutional sales of XRP that can be legally called securities but not XRP sales in the secondary market.

Everything is security but Bitcoin

Gary Gensler is positive that Bitcoin is the only cryptocurrency that can be free from the labels of a "security." As for Ethereum, his stance here remains somewhat unclear as he recently stated that the second biggest cryptocurrency might still be a security.

Cardano's native token ADA has also been on the list of securities recently, and founder of IOG Charles Hoskinson, the company behind Cardano blockchain, has opposed that opinion several times on his Twitter page.

The aforementioned list of the SEC also includes HEX, DASH, BTT, FIL, BUSD and ATOM.

title: Thaiwatsadu to open 3 more stores in final months of 2023 - Bangkok Post
content:
Thaiwatsadu to open 3 more stores in final months of 2023

The entrance of Thaiwatsadu x BnB home in Samut Prakan province. This is the company's fourth branch in the province, complementing stores on Bang Na-Trat Road, in Bang Phli and Phra Pradaeng.

CRC Thaiwatsadu Co, a home improvement and material construction unit under Central Retail Corporation, plans to open three new stores during the remaining five months of this year.

Suthisarn Chirathivat, Thaiwatsadu's chief executive, said the company invested 470 million baht to open its latest Thaiwatsadu x BnB home branch, with a space of 20,000 square metres, in the Muang Samut Prakan district of Samut Prakan province on Thursday.

In addition, the company is scheduled to open its second store in Chiang Mai next month, followed by another store in Sri Sa Ket province.

For 2023, Thaiwatsadu aims to open 10 new branches. As of this month, the company has launched eight new branches under the Thaiwatsadu x BnB home and Thaiwatsadu concepts, covering significant locations in Bangkok and other regions.

According to Mr Suthisarn, this expansion aligns with CRC's "retailligence" strategic plan and is well-timed with the positive trajectory of the construction material market and real estate sector, both of which have regained momentum after years of stagnation.

He said the Samut Prakan store marks the company's fourth establishment in the province, complementing the existing branches on Bang Na-Trat Road, in Bang Phli and Phra Pradaeng.

Mr Suthisarn said Samut Prakan has recorded a growing economic prominence, which is increasing demand for construction materials and home furnishings from entrepreneurs, businesses of all sizes, retail customers, and the province's vast population of more than 198,500 households.

Strategically positioned, the new branch also serves the needs of residents in nearby districts.

The store offers a range of construction materials and home furnishings from renowned brands, boasting more than 40,000 items.

The Thaiwatsadu x BnB concept strives to cater to the needs of the hardware and electrical equipment segments, offering hand tools, electrical appliances, bathroom accessories, kitchen essentials, bedroom furnishings and home decorations.

Located to the east of Bangkok, the branch leverages the purchasing power of the area, while also catering to large projects in promising regions such as Samut Prakan, Sukhumvit and Srinakarin, he said.

In a step towards sustainability, the new branch installed solar panels on its roof, generating 1 megawatt peak of renewable energy through an off-grid system.

Mr Suthisarn said this initiative can reduce electricity bills by up to 40-50%.

"We are confident in the immense potential of the province, driven by its robust transport, public facilities and route expansion plans, as well as the growing interest from companies undertaking significant development projects," he said.

"All of these factors have enabled Thaiwatsadu to become a trusted brand and a platform that consistently meets the evolving needs of its expanding customer base."

title: Prices and news of Binance Coin (BNB) and Shiba Inu (SHIB) - The Cryptonomist
content:
Although both Binance Coin (BNB) and Shiba Inu (SHIB) boast unique features and use cases, their trajectories have been remarkably eventful, filled with price hikes and groundbreaking news that have captivated investors and enthusiasts alike.

In this article we delve into the news surrounding Binance Coin and Shiba Inu, exploring the factors behind their price fluctuations and the significant news that has influenced their trajectories.

Prices and market statistics of Binance Coin and Shiba Inu

Shiba Inu (SHIB)

At the time of writing this article, the price of the cryptocurrency Shiba Inu (SHIB) stands at $0.00000926 per unit.

Over the past 7 days, the price of SHIBA INU has seen a significant increase of 10.78%, signaling interesting growth in the market.

The market capitalization of the cryptocurrency amounts to $5.5 billion, while the trading volume of the past 24 hours reaches $304.0 million, demonstrating investors’ continued interest in this digital asset.

Currently, there are 589.3 billion SHIB in circulation, and the average holding time of the cryptocurrency is 222 days.

Despite its price fluctuations, Shiba Inu ranked as the 12th most popular cryptocurrency, highlighting its growing relevance in the crypto ecosystem. SHIB’s all-time high was $0.000032, an important figure for those who closely follow market trends.

With a positive price change of 10.78% over the past 7 days, investors and cryptocurrency enthusiasts are eagerly awaiting further developments for this ever-evolving coin.

Binance Coin (BNB)

The price of the cryptocurrency Binance Coin (BNB) stands at $243.84 per unit. Over the past 7 days, the price of BNB has slightly increased by 0.18%, showing a stable market pace.

The market capitalization of Binance Coin has reached the amount of $37.5 billion, while the trading volume of the last 24 hours amounts to $376.6 million, reflecting a steady interest from investors in this digital currency.

There are currently 153.9 million BNB in circulation, which helps strengthen its position in the cryptocurrency landscape. BNB’s all-time high was $690.93, a significant level that could be a benchmark for investors and analysts closely following the coin’s price.

With a modest 0.18% growth over the past week, Binance Coin is showing signs of resilience and continues to generate interest in the cryptocurrency market.

Binance Coin prepares for mainnet upgrade

BNB Chain, the native blockchain of Binance Coin (BNB), is preparing for a significant mainnet upgrade in August, with the goal of addressing the declining metrics observed in recent months.

Despite the difficulties, BNB managed to accomplish a remarkable feat, surpassing Ripple (XRP) to become the fourth largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization.

The data revealed a decline in the amount of gas on BNB Smart Chain, indicative of less activity on the blockchain.

As a result, the acquired value of the platform has also been trending downward, reflected in plummeting fees and revenues. In addition, the DeFi space on the BNB Chain has seen troubling developments, with declines in total value locked (TVL), active addresses, and transactions.

BNB’s hope on new updates

However, there is hope on the horizon: BNB Chain has announced its next mainnet update, version 1.2.9 for the BSC mainnet.

Scheduled for 10 August, the first update will introduce the Plato and Hertz hard forks, while the second is scheduled for 30 August 2023.

This update is expected to make improvements to the blockchain’s gas metering system, impose restrictions on contract distribution, introduce a new EVM opcode, and implement new transaction types, following the guidelines of BEP 225 and BEP 230 under the Berlin update.

As the development of the upgrade progressed, BNB bulls entered the market, contributing to a marginal increase in the value of the coin.

Binance Coin surpasses Ripple

This momentum allowed BNB to surpass XRP and reclaim its position as the fourth largest cryptocurrency in terms of market capitalization. The increase in BNB’s social volume and improved sentiment around the coin further strengthened its position, while the green funding rate reflects the high demand in the futures market.

However, the relative strength index (RSI) moved sideways at the neutral level, while the Chaikin Money Flow (CMF) remained bearish with a slight decline.

With the mainnet upgrade on the horizon and positive market developments, BNB is showing resilience in the face of challenges.

Investors and users are anxiously awaiting the impact of the upcoming update on blockchain performance and metrics. The update’s ability to address declining gas quantity and other concerns in the DeFi space could potentially rejuvenate interest in and usage of the BNB blockchain.

As the blockchain landscape continues to evolve, BNB is positioning itself for further growth and importance within the cryptocurrency market. Rivalry for top ranking positions is fierce, but BNB has demonstrated its determination to compete and succeed.

The upcoming mainnet update could be a turning point for BNB Chain, elevating it to new heights and reaffirming its importance in the ever-expanding world of cryptocurrencies.

Investors and enthusiasts are closely watching developments as BNB aims to reclaim its place at the forefront of the digital financial revolution.

Shytoshi Kusama, leader of Shiba Inu, routs scammers amid enthusiasm for Summer of Shibarium campaign

Shiba Inu, the cryptocurrency inspired by a meme, is causing a stir in the cryptocurrency community with its highly anticipated “Summer of Shibarium” campaign.

As excitement grows for the release of new tokens and the launch of the project’s Layer 2 blockchain, Shibarium, lead developer Shytoshi Kusama has been actively fighting the wave of misinformation and scams targeting investors of the coin.

Recently, a Twitter post claimed that two new tokens, TREAT and SHI, would be launched as part of the “Summer of Shibarium” campaign. However, Kusama was quick to deny this information, dismissing it as a scam and warning the community to remain vigilant.

Unfortunately, this incident is just one of many scams that have surfaced during the preparation of the “Summer of Shibarium” campaign.

The hype surrounding the strategic initiative has increased market interest in SHIB and related tokens, creating an ideal environment for scammers to exploit unsuspecting investors.

The “Summer of Shibarium” campaign promises a series of exciting releases, leading up to the highly anticipated launch of the Shibarium Layer 2 blockchain in August.

Although the legitimate excitement is well founded, Kusama stresses the need for caution and investor education in the face of fraudulent activity.

In response to growing concerns, the Shibarmy Scam Alerts Twitter account has been actively warning the community about fake support accounts and suspicious links circulating in the crypto space. Kusama, as a constant advocate of vigilance, urges investors to thoroughly scrutinize all sources of information before making any decisions.

Excitement and caution, the right balance for investing in meme coins

As the launch of Shibarium approaches, it is critical that Shiba Inu enthusiasts and investors strike a balance between excitement and caution. The cryptocurrency space is full of opportunities, but also risks, so it is essential to remain alert and discerning.

Market participants should be wary of promises that seem too good to be true, as scams can take many forms, including the issuance of fake tokens, phishing attempts, and Ponzi schemes. Using official channels and verifying information from reliable sources can significantly reduce the risk of falling victim to scams.

Kusama’s commitment to protecting the Shiba Inu community from scams is a testament to the importance of promoting a secure and transparent cryptographic environment. With the Summer of Shibarium campaign on the horizon, the community must join efforts to stay informed and support each other.
